item.title: Autobrake System – AUTO BRAKES Light Illuminated

remarks.para: May be inoperative with AUTO BRAKES light illuminated and autobrake switch OFF provided:

numlitem.para: Autobrake solenoid valve must be verified closed, and
Approach minimums do not require its use.
Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 3a.

placard.para: Placard the Autobrake Selector panel "SYSTEM INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: Verify the autobrake solenoid valve position.
Apply the electrical power to the aircraft.
Place the AUTOBRAKE SELECTOR SWITCH to the OFF position.

If the AUTOBRAKE light is no longer illuminated, then an autobrake solenoid malfunction is not indicated and the autobrake solenoid valve is assumed to be closed. The aircraft can now be dispatched per the MEL.
If the AUTO BRAKE light remains illuminated, perform the following:
Depressurize the RIGHT and LEFT hydraulic systems.
Pump the brake pedals until the brake accumulator pressure gage on the First Officer's panel will reduce no further (approximately 1300 psi).

If the AUTO BRAKE light remains illuminated after performing step 3, then an autobrake solenoid valve pressure switch or indication system malfunction is indicated and the autobrake solenoid valve is closed. The aircraft can be now be dispatched per the MEL.

If the AUTO BRAKE light is no longer illuminated, the autobrake solenoid valve has failed open and the autobrake valve module must be hydraulically deactivated per Dispatch Maintenance Procedures 32-42-4-3.
